dmca.title: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist -- Immediately [BF2]]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
Policy Enforcement
Sent: Friday, April 07, 2006 6:50 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist -- Immediately [BF2]]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

For your review.
- --
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

- -------- Original Message --------
From: - Fri Apr 07 06:33:57 2006
X-Mozilla-Status: 0001
X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000
Received: from localhost ([127.0.0.1] helo=[216.185.111.52])        by
mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com)
with esmtp (Exim)        id 1FRhJN-0005Mc-90; Thu, 06 Apr 2006 22:07:01 -0500
Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181]
helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com)        by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from
jeff@jrm.cc)        with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id
1FRhJL-0005MG-87        for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 06 Apr 2006 22:06:59
-0500
Received: from omicron.asmallorange.com ([70.84.128.212])        by
mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jeff@jrm.cc)        with esmtps
(TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1FRhJH-000OUg-Lb        for
abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 06 Apr 2006 22:06:58 -0500
Received: from 64-142-94-171.dsl.static.sonic.net
([64.142.94.171]:1896        helo=[192.168.1.42])        by omicron.asmallorange.com
with esmtpa (Exim 4.52)        id 1FRhIz-0003F3-Qa; Thu, 06 Apr 2006 23:06:44 -0400
Message-ID: <4435D73D.4060902@jrm.cc>
Date: Thu, 06 Apr 2006 20:06:37 -0700
From: Jeff Minard <jeff@jrm.cc>
User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird 1.0.7 (Windows/20050923)
X-Accept-Language: en-us, en
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: bf2e@gmail.com,  abuse@theplanet.com
Content-Type: multipart/mixed;
boundary="------------060308050307060202040608"
X-Antivirus-Scanner: Clean mail though you should still use an Antivirus
X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse,        please include it
with any abuse report
X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - omicron.asmallorange.com
X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - theplanet.com
X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [0 0] / [47 12]
X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - jrm.cc
X-Source:
X-Source-Args:
X-Source-Dir:
Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 70.84.128.212 is neither
permitted nor denied by domain of jrm.cc)        client-ip=70.84.128.212;
envelope-from=jeff@jrm.cc;        helo=omicron.asmallorange.com;
Subject: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist -- Immediately [BF2]
X-BeenThere: abuse@lists.theplanet.com
X-Mailman-Version: 2.1.7
Precedence: list
List-Id: <abuse.lists.theplanet.com>
List-Unsubscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Post: <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
List-Help: <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
List-Subscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
Sender: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
Errors-To: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com

"Dan",

You are using copyright material stolen from BF2S.com for your stats display
at http://bf2e.com. You have 24 hours to remove all content in violation of
copyright or more serious legal action will be taken against you and your
ISP.

This is a blatant, complete, and highly illegal reproduction of copyright
protected work: design, style, layout, graphics, and functionality.

Again, you have 24 hours to remove all infringing copyright material.
Failure to do so will escalate this matter to a much less friendly level.


Regards,

Jeff Minard
http://bf2s.com

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
